attributes.action: Ban the use of the word Honorable in Commons and Lords
attributes.additional_details:
Honorable is meant to be, honorable to the people who elect them, honorable to the Law they voted an passed to leave on the 29th March, 
honorable to their Manifesto's,
honorable in having faith in our great country, 
Considering the UK is the world's capital of democracy, we (THE PEOPLE) feel the UK no longer has democracy and have displaced themselves from the nation, There is NO longer honor with parliament.  everyone i know friends an family have said they will no longer vote in any Parliamentary elections Labor an Conservative have lost the trust of the people.
attributes.background: Parliament refer to each other as  my Honorable' this word is NOW misrepresented as there are probably only about 2% of parliament who are actually Honorable.
